alt1: Residency-rented truck parked on Argyle street, in Halifax NS.
title: The Moving Truck
preBlurb: between October 1999 and January 2001, the residency lived in a truck--a moving truck.
blurb: between October 1999 and January 2001, the residency lives in a truck--a moving truck.
postBlurb: between October 1999 and January 2001, the residency will live in a truck--a moving truck.

alt1: Artist-rendering of an imaginary residency local, a dark sweet-smelling floor.
caption1: The things we know, just by knowing darkness.
title: The Floor
lead: when there was enough space on the floor
preBlurb: Wherever she lives, there is always a floor.
blurb: Wherever she lives, there is always a floor.
postBlurb: Wherever she lived, there was always a floor.

caption1: The middle room was often empty, as it was in the middle of everything.
title: The middle room
preBlurb: Those were the days of middle rooms.
blurb: These are the days of middle rooms.
postBlurb: These will be the days of middle rooms

caption1: By the end there was nothing left to photograph.
title: All my Stuff
blurb: Fullscript evaluates his life, as it stacks like tetris pieces into a moving truck going nowhere.

alt1: drawing of a cat and a moose wearing cardigans.
title: Art in the Movies
blurb: Art in the movies is art for the movies. It benefits from a narrow context. To anyone who knows about the art world, it looks like something made by a novice--probably the director's brother-in-law.

alt1: An image of cards, and not the playing kind.
caption1: Who will play against a joker / a king?
title: Only Lies
blurb: In these times, we thought it might be fun to explore the rich universe of the Lie. What is a lie? What might a world of only lies look and feel like? How could such a construct even sustain itself. The boundaries of lies, and how such boundaries might clarify fiction, and truth.

caption1: While we prepared an image of our favourite whispers, they hushed us.
title: Whispered Stories
blurb: Reading with eyes closed. Stacey Ruggenbaum has taken on the task of launching a new Press project: 'Whispered audiobooks.' There are moments where only a whisper will do.

toolTip1: Who censored out the research program?
title: HOME
lead: The Liberal Arts Fictional Institute of Narrative
blurb: Lafin's origin story always harkens back to a ship. .

title: Everything is Happening in Secret
blurb: The academics are not sharing what they're up to at this moment. This is possibly because they're up to no good.

caption1: 1987, photo, bird nesting outside the Education Wing south window.
title: Continuing the important work in fiction.
blurb:
We are figments of a good for nothing imagination.
It's difficult to explain further. It's quite simple. We interrogate reality because it is foreign to us.

alt1: a friend who makes his own jeans
caption1: Grandma, why are your ears so long?
title: Everything is Happening in Secret
blurb: The gallery is not sharing what it's up to at this moment. This is possibly because it's up to no good.

caption1: A bunny buddy. A good friend.
title: Everything is Happening in Secret
blurb: The presses are running? Or are they hiding? They are not sharing, not at the moment. This is possibly because they are up to no good.

title: Everything is Happening in Secret
blurb: Secret research is not always bad...

title: All the lovely visits we remember
blurb: The residency program is currently being all too secretive.

caption1: Buns and rolls for tree dwelling sorts.
title: Who we are
blurb: Who we are, on days like today, is a mystery even to ourselves [...]

title: Not Quite a Fuzzy Artist
blurb: Currently residing in the back of an anonymous pick-up truck, our resident is, for this week only, a caterpillar.

title: Winter 2020
blurb: Winter Session, come back later... we aren't ready for the snow.

alt1: The image of a cat in leggings
title: SOnoRizaTIon
blurb: Currently on show: the art of M. Leon Leroux. Pioneer in the Upwards and Downwards Movements, Mr Leroux has spent the last 10 years creating SOnoRizaTIon, a persistent montage of daily vocalizations on a white background of milk and fish.

caption1: every dream in one succinct image. areal view.
title: Flying Dreams
blurb: Do you dream of flying? Our current research project exists in the form of a survey.

alt1: Insomniac drawings of shadows on the floor.
caption1: There are five windows, but only one door.
title: A Way Out
blurb: An insomniac's drawings of shadows on the floor. What happens when God closes a window? What happens when the wind blows through, and messes up all the papers?

title: I'm not going anywhere
blurb: Every relationship is its own special economy, defined by its unique brand of transactionality. That's why, the protagonist that journeys through a capitalist framework is isolated by it, ensconced in predictable relationships and plastic drama. And why not? When economics and poetry can no longer share the stage, the individual is left with nothing.

caption1: In 2003, a battle of the icons declared a tie between rain and hail.
title: We can no longer differentiate between rain and hail
blurb: In this era of doomsday meteorology, emerges a strange subgroup of citizen scientists mesuring rain, not with modern day tools and technologies, not even with pre-modern instruments. This is a careful and long-term study by those who use just their bodies, and sometimes a mug full of coffee, to delve into the phenomenological study of the thining line between rain and hail.

caption1: the template for dreams is an alternate linearity.
title: Dream Templates
blurb: trying to pin things down in a dream causes a kind of spiralling, a written note whose symbols morph, and float, and where meaning never stands st.

alt1: drawing of a bed, covered with small curly hairs
caption1: The closet is not the safest place to sleep.
title: Sleeping with a Monster in the Closet
blurb: As artist in residence of the Closet Residency, a one-time offshoot residency program, organized by Vincent Applebee, while he was an artist in residence at Lafin's Middle Room residency.

alt1: photo of a tiny map sent by the mail
title: positioning system
blurb: Folded paper road maps, memory palaces, trips back home, google street view frozen moments, cities in disrepair, cities under water, the long descriptive passages that bridge internal and external places.

alt1: Book cover: a child, mom, and pair of scissors in freefall.
title: Prepare for a soft landing
blurb: Some quiet transitions mark moments that plead for a sound effect--the moment that sucks the air out of a room, affording silence instead of fanfare.

alt1: book cover. Image of a secret.
caption1: You'll never believe what I heard...
title: Under your hat.
blurb: Inside the clamber bondyo shinset boo of the pommel pommel blintz, there are secrets no one will tell, but I heard, because, well... listen, I can't say it too loud, you know, but it's a fact that the stuff you hear through the walls are only as true as all that.

alt1: Image of a humpty dumpty as an elizabethan egg.
caption1: The perils of walls: sitting on, writing on, building up, breaking down.
title: The Walls
lead: Robert Kozlowski, Fred Morse, et al.
blurb: The Chinese Wall of wall-related research, with as large a scope as possible, and absolutely no funding. Embracing cross disciplinary approaches and scientific antagonism, this four-year expedition through Wall Investigations brings together anthropology, dream experiments, travel, thought experiments, and glue-slathered popsicle sticks.

title: The highway to there.
